etymologies: late 18th century. From post-classical Latin and scientific Latin Hippurites fossil bivalve mollusc from classical Latin hippūris mare's tail + -itēs. So called on account of the resemblance of the form of the mollusc to that of a horsetail

definitions: Any fossil bivalve mollusc of the family Hippuritidae; a rudist.
Designating rock (especially limestone) or strata containing fossil bivalve molluscs of the family Hippuritidae. Compare hippuritic. Now chiefly historical.
